title: Kit Check Adds Children's Hospital of Orange County as 200th Hospital Customer
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/21/2015 @ 3:00 AM   Kit Check 
WASHINGTON, Oct. 21, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Kit Check (TM) ( http://kitcheck.com ), the leader in hospital pharmacy kit restocking and medication tracking software, announced that Children's Hospital of Orange County (CHOC Children's) became the 200(th) hospital to adopt the company's cloud software and RFID technology solution. More than 10,000 hospital users track in excess of 25,000 pharmacy kits with Kit Check. Since its first site at the University of Maryland Medical Center, Kit Check users have tracked over seven million medications. Growth in the user base continues to accelerate with hospital customers doubling again in just one year. 
"Directors of hospital pharmacy face numerous challenges. I am happy that Kit Check has successfully eliminated the problems of manual pharmacy kit restocking for more than 200 hospitals. Tim and I founded Kit Check as a friend to the pharmacist. We saw too many manual processes that introduced risk of human error and added to the labor crunch faced by hospital pharmacies. At the same time, many healthcare technology vendors still treat pharmacy as an afterthought. We focus our sole attention on applying new cloud and RFID technologies to solving tangible problems in the pharmacy. I am proud to say that focus is making a difference and users are responding," said Kit Check Co-founder and CEO Kevin MacDonald. 
Kit Check Vice President of Sales Doug Zurawski, PharmD., commented, "Hospital pharmacy kit restocking has been known for years as 'the worst job in the pharmacy.' Data shows that with Kit Check, this is no longer true. In addition to hard-dollar savings in overtime and inventory, Kit Check users repeatedly report improved staff satisfaction. As a former Director of Pharmacy, I recognize how rare it is to reduce cost and errors while simultaneously increasing staff morale. I also recognize how little data access I had to do my job. Kit Check's new reporting features provide a level of medication data visibility and analysis that has previously been unavailable for pharmacy kits and anesthesia medications. It is a pleasure to bring this solution to my former colleagues because I know it works and Kit Check does whatever it takes to make users successful." 
About Hospital Pharmacy Kits Pharmacy kits are used throughout hospitals for critical care procedures including operating room anesthesia, crash carts, pediatric emergency, labor and delivery and others. Kit Check's solution eliminates a decades-old manual process and studies show that RFID combined with Kit Check's cloud-based software enables these processes to be completed 71-96% faster with 99.5-100% higher accuracy. 
About Kit Check(TM) Kit Check(TM) is the leader in automated hospital pharmacy kit processing and medication tracking software. Since 2012, Kit Check(TM) has focused on replacing time consuming and error prone manual processes in hospital medication handling with faster and safer automation technologies driven by a scalable cloud software platform. Kit Check(TM) is headquartered in Washington, DC and serves hospitals throughout the U.S. For more information please contact Kit Check(TM) by email at PR@kitcheck.com or call at (786) 548-2432 ext. 5.
